111Desert Strike: Return to the Gulf was a well received shooter originally for the Sega Genesis, and was later ported to a variety of platforms.

Story

A year after the Gulf War, General Ibn Kilbaba takes over a small Arab Emirate and plans to start World War III. Using an AH-64 Apache, the player must open the way for groun d troops and finally take on the "Madman" himself.

Gameplay

The game is played from an isometric perspect ive in open levels that allow free movement in all directions by scrolling the screen with the movement of the helicopter. Each level consists of many varying objectives that range anywhere from destroying enemy bases and vehicles, to capturing enemy troop s or rescuing friendly ones. While bases and vehicles are simply destroyed, both friendly and enemy troops must be taken back to base for extraction. The Apache AH-64 has limited room inside, so multiple trips to and from the base may be necessary These ob jectives aren't always linear, and can often times be tackled in whatever order the player chooses. This combination of free mov ement and non-linear structure separated it from many of the other shooters of that period.

There are three weapo ns of varying strength and usefulness available to the Apache AH-64: machine guns, hydra missiles and hellfire missiles, which i ncrease in strength respectively. Each of these weapons has a limited number of ammo which can only be replenished by picking up ammo crates on the mission, or resupplying back at the base. Similarly, the Apache AH-64 only has a limited amount of fuel that will drain slowly over the course of each level. If the fuel runs out, the helicopter crashes and the player loses a life. Refu eling works exactly the same as restocking ammo.

Lives are lost when either the Apache AH-64 takes too much damag e and is destroyed, or when it runs out of fuel. After three lives have been lost, the game is over. Due to the nature of the ga me's freedom, each level requires a certain amount of planning and strategy in order to complete all of the objectives while sti ll having enough fuel, ammo, and health to survive.

Ports

Due to its popularity on the Sega Genesis in 1992, the game was then ported to the Amiga, Master System, and SNES in the same year. Two years later in 1994, it was released on the PC. It was also ported to most handheld systems such as the Lynx in 1993, Game Gear in 1994, Game Boy in 1995 Game Boy Advance in 2002, and fina lly the PSP in 2006 as part of EA Replay.

111Breakfree is a combination of Doom and Breakout--a first-person block-breaking game.Overview

Breakfree, released in 1995 by Software Storm, Inc., is a first-person block-breaking game. The goal of the game is also its title--players must destroy the walls that surround them by bouncing projectiles into the walls. Like traditional block-breaking games, some bl ocks contain power-ups, and losing all of the projectiles means game over for the player.

Overview

Bass Avenger is a fishing game developed by Hypnotix and published by Simon & Schuster Interactive for the PC and Mac platforms.

http://www.giantbomb.com/api/genre/3060-27/27http://www.giantbomb.com/games/?wikiSlug=fishing&wikiTypeId=3060&wikiId=27&genre =270 OK10111Smackdown Vs. Raw 2007 is the third installment in the Smackdown Vs. Raw series.

Ov erview

Smackdown Vs. Raw 2007 is a wrestling game developed by Yuke's and published by THQ on November 14th 2006. Smackdown Vs. Raw 2007 is the third game in WWE's Smackdown Vs. Raw franch ise. Smackdown Vs. Raw 2007 was the first game in the series to be released on a non-Sony console.

WWE SmackDown! vs. RAW 2007 was originally planned to also be released on the PlayStation 3 platform, but was ultimately cance lled before release.

Gameplay

New Features

Smackdown vs Raw 2007 introduced the analog grappling system to the series, allowing the player to grapple using the right analog stick. Using the stick alone would do a weak grapple , while using RB(R1 for PS2) together with the right stick would cause the player's wrestler to hold the opponent in a grapple h old. Moving the right analog stick again makes the player's wrestler perform a grapple move.

Another new feature brought to Smackdown Vs. Raw 2007 is the fact that a characters move set changes depending on the weight class assigned to them. Also new to Smackdown vs Raw 2007 are environmental grapples. These environment hot spots allow the player to perform moves in a quick time event style control scheme that uses a specific place or item.

Momentum

Smackdown Vs. Raw 2007 uses a momentum system for it's fin ishing maneuvers. The momentum meter will fluctuate back and forth depending on how well the player is doing in the match. If th e player can pull off multiple types of moves in succession the momentum meter will rise quickly, however getting hit by the opp onents moves will lower the meter. The characters attribute of clean or dirty will make a difference as to which moves will buil d the momentum meter quickly. Performing the same move repeatedly will make the players momentum meter fall.

Location Spe cific Damage

In Smackdown Vs. Raw 2007 a player can target individual body parts. There is a graphic on the top of the screen that shows a silhouette of a wrestler for each player. As damage on a specific body part increases it will change color on the silhouette.

Stamina
